entities.description: Daily transaction file. Sequential file defined in FILE-CONTROL assigned to DALYTRAN. Organization is SEQUENTIAL, Access Mode is SEQUENTIAL, File Status is DALYTRAN-STATUS. File Definition in DATA DIVISION.
File status variable for DALYTRAN-FILE. Group item for daily transaction file status. Acts as the file status code for the daily transaction file.

Customer file. Indexed file defined in FILE-CONTROL assigned to CUSTFILE. It has ORGANIZATION IS INDEXED, ACCESS MODE IS RANDOM, RECORD KEY IS FD-CUST-ID, and FILE STATUS IS CUSTFILE-STATUS. File descriptor (FD) defined in the FILE SECTION of the DATA DIVISION.
Record key variable for CUSTOMER-FILE. Customer ID field within FD-CUSTFILE-REC. Elementary item PIC 9(09).
File status variable for CUSTOMER-FILE. Group item defined in WORKING-STORAGE. Used as the file status code for the customer file.

Cross-reference file. Indexed file defined in FILE-CONTROL assigned to XREFFILE with random access mode, record key FD-XREF-CARD-NUM, and file status XREFFILE-STATUS. File descriptor (FD) defined in the FILE SECTION with record FD-XREFFILE-REC, containing fields FD-XREF-CARD-NUM and FD-XREF-DATA.
Record key variable for XREF-FILE. Cross-reference card number field within FD-XREFFILE-REC. Elementary item PIC X(16). Used as the key field for reading the cross-reference file.

File status variable for XREF-FILE. Group item defined in WORKING-STORAGE representing the cross-reference file status. It is used in the Procedure Division to validate the success of file operations (e.g., OPEN, CLOSE).

Indexed file defined in FILE-CONTROL assigned to CARDFILE. Organization is INDEXED, access mode is RANDOM, record key is FD-CARD-NUM, and file status is CARDFILE-STATUS. File descriptor (FD) defined in FILE SECTION with record FD-CARDFILE-REC containing fields FD-CARD-NUM (PIC X(16)) and FD-CARD-DATA (PIC X(134)). Used as a Card file in the procedure division.
Card number field within FD-CARDFILE-REC for CARD-FILE. Record key variable. Elementary item PIC X(16).
File status variable for CARD-FILE. Group item defined in WORKING-STORAGE. Used to store the file status code for the card file operations.

Indexed file defined in FILE-CONTROL assigned to ACCTFILE. Organization is INDEXED, Access Mode is RANDOM, Record Key is FD-ACCT-ID, File Status is ACCTFILE-STATUS. File descriptor defined in FILE SECTION with record FD-ACCTFILE-REC. Used as the Account file.
Record key variable for ACCOUNT-FILE and Account ID field within FD-ACCTFILE-REC. Elementary item PIC 9(11). Used as the key field for reading the account file.
File status variable for ACCOUNT-FILE. Group item defined in WORKING-STORAGE for account file status. Used to check the success of file operations on the account file.

Indexed file defined in FILE-CONTROL assigned to TRANFILE. Organization is INDEXED, access mode is RANDOM, record key is FD-TRANS-ID, and file status is TRANFILE-STATUS. File descriptor (FD) defined in FILE SECTION with record FD-TRANFILE-REC.
Transaction ID field within FD-TRANFILE-REC. Record key variable for TRANSACT-FILE. Elementary item PIC X(16).
File status variable for TRANSACT-FILE. Group item for transaction file status.
Record definition for DALYTRAN-FILE
Transaction ID field within FD-TRAN-RECORD. Elementary item PIC X(16).
Customer data field defined in FD-TRAN-RECORD (DALYTRAN-FILE) as PIC X(334) and in FD-CUSTFILE-REC (CUSTOMER-FILE) as PIC X(491).
Record definition for CUSTOMER-FILE
Record definition for XREF-FILE
Elementary item PIC X(34). Cross-reference data field within FD-XREFFILE-REC.
Record definition for CARD-FILE
Elementary item PIC X(134). Card data field within FD-CARDFILE-REC.
Record definition for ACCOUNT-FILE
Account data field within FD-ACCTFILE-REC. Elementary item PIC X(289) defined in ACCOUNT-FILE. Also defined as PIC X(334) within FD-TRANFILE-REC in TRANSACT-FILE (Line 94).
Record definition for TRANSACT-FILE
Elementary item PIC X. First byte of daily transaction file status.
Elementary item PIC X. Second byte of daily transaction file status.
First byte of customer file status. Elementary item PIC X
Elementary item PIC X. Second byte of customer file status.
Elementary item PIC X. First byte of cross-reference file status.
Elementary item PIC X. Second byte of cross-reference file status.
First byte of card file status. Elementary item PIC X.
Elementary item PIC X. Second byte of card file status.
Elementary item PIC X. First byte of account file status.
Second byte of account file status. Elementary item PIC X.
First byte of transaction file status. Elementary item PIC X.
Second byte of transaction file status. Elementary item PIC X.
Group item for general I/O status, used to hold file status codes from various file operations for error reporting.
First byte of general I/O status. Elementary item PIC X.
Elementary item PIC X. Second byte of general I/O status.
Elementary item PIC 9(4) BINARY. Two-byte binary numeric variable.
Group item REDEFINES TWO-BYTES-BINARY. Redefinition of TWO-BYTES-BINARY as alphanumeric.
Elementary item PIC X. Left byte of the two-byte structure.
Elementary item PIC X. Right byte of the two-byte structure.
Group item for specific IO status structure.
Elementary item PIC 9 VALUE 0. Numeric component of IO-STATUS-04.
Elementary item PIC 999 VALUE 0. Numeric component of IO-STATUS-04.
Application result code (COMP). Elementary item PIC S9(9) COMP.
Condition name for APPL-RESULT indicating success (VALUE 0). Used throughout the program to verify successful application results after I/O operations.
Condition name for APPL-RESULT indicating EOF (16). Used to check for end-of-file status in application result processing.
Elementary item PIC X(01) VALUE 'N'. Flag indicating end of daily transaction file.
Abend code variable. Elementary item PIC S9(9) BINARY.
Timing variable. Elementary item PIC S9(9) BINARY.
Group item for miscellaneous variables.
Elementary item PIC 9(04). Status variable for the cross-reference file read operation.
Elementary item PIC 9(04). Read status for ACCT file. Status variable for the account file read operation.
Record structure for the daily transaction file.
Card number from the daily transaction record.
Card number used for cross-reference lookup.
Account ID retrieved from the cross-reference file.
Account ID used for account file operations.
Transaction ID from the daily transaction record.
Record structure for the cross-reference file.
Customer ID from the cross-reference record.
Record structure for the account file.
